chunk:
https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1085) is a backdoor written in C and C++ that is known to be used by [FIN8](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0061), as early as August 2021 to target a financial institution in the United States. [Sardonic](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1085) has a plugin system that can load specially made DLLs and execute their functions.(Citation: Bitdefender Sardonic Aug 2021)(Citation: Symantec FIN8 Jul 2023)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ISMInjector
Software description: [ISMInjector](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0189) is a Trojan used to install another [OilRig](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0049) backdoor, ISMAgent. (Citation: OilRig New Delivery Oct 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: PITSTOP
Software description: [PITSTOP](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1123) is a backdoor that was deployed on compromised Ivanti Connect Secure VPNs during [Cutting Edge](https://attack.mitre.org/campaigns/C0029) to enable command execution and file read/write.(Citation: Mandiant Cutting Edge Part 3 February 2024)
Platforms: Network

Software name: JHUHUGIT
Software description: [JHUHUGIT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0044) is malware used by [APT28](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0007). It is based on Carberp source code and serves as reconnaissance malware. (Citation: Kaspersky Sofacy) (Citation: F-Secure Sofacy 2015) (Citation: ESET Sednit Part 1) (Citation: FireEye APT28 January 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: QakBot
Software description: [QakBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0650) is a modular banking trojan that has been used primarily by financially-motivated actors since at least 2007. [QakBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0650) is continuously maintained and developed and has evolved from an information stealer into a delivery agent for ransomware, most notably [ProLock](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0654) and [Egregor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0554).(Citation: Trend Micro Qakbot December 2020)(Citation: Red Canary Qbot)(Citation: Kaspersky QakBot September 2021)(Citation: ATT QakBot April 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Zebrocy
Software description: [Zebrocy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0251) is a Trojan that has been used by [APT28](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0007) since at least November 2015. The malware comes in several programming language variants, including C++, Delphi, AutoIt, C#, VB.NET, and Golang. (Citation: Palo Alto Sofacy 06-2018)(Citation: Unit42 Cannon Nov 2018)(Citation: Unit42 Sofacy Dec 2018)(Citation: CISA Zebrocy Oct 2020) 
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Attor
Software description: [Attor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0438) is a Windows-based espionage platform that has been seen in use since 2013. [Attor](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0438) has a loadable plugin architecture to customize functionality for specific targets.(Citation: ESET Attor Oct 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TinyZBot
Software description: [TinyZBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0004) is a bot written in C# that was developed by [Cleaver](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0003). (Citation: Cylance Cleaver)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Gazer
Software description: [Gazer](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0168) is a backdoor used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) since at least 2016. (Citation: ESET Gazer Aug 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Duqu
Software description: [Duqu](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0038) is a malware platform that uses a modular approach to extend functionality after deployment within a target network. (Citation: Symantec W32.Duqu)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: CSPY Downloader
Software description: [CSPY Downloader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0527) is a tool designed to evade analysis and download additional payloads used by [Kimsuky](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0094).(Citation: Cybereason Kimsuky November 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ZxxZ
Software description: [ZxxZ](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1013) is a trojan written in Visual C++ that has been used by [BITTER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1002) since at least August 2021, including against Bangladeshi government personnel.(Citation: Cisco Talos Bitter Bangladesh May 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TinyTurla
Software description: [TinyTurla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0668) is a backdoor that has been used

entities.name: FIN8
entities.description: FIN8 is a cybercriminal group known for targeting financial institutions, utilizing various malware and tactics since at least August 2021.

entities.name: SARDONIC
entities.description: Sardonic is a backdoor malware written in C and C++ used by FIN8 to target financial institutions.

entities.name: OILRIG
entities.description: OilRig is a cyber espionage group that uses various malware, including ISMInjector, to infiltrate systems.

entities.name: ISMINJECTOR
entities.description: ISMInjector is a Trojan that installs another backdoor, ISMAgent, used by the OilRig group.

entities.name: PITSTOP
entities.description: PITSTOP is a backdoor malware deployed on compromised Ivanti Connect Secure VPNs during the Cutting Edge campaign.

entities.name: CUTTING EDGE
entities.description: Cutting Edge is a campaign during which the PITSTOP backdoor was deployed to enable command execution and file read/write.

entities.name: JHUHUGIT
entities.description: JHUHUGIT is malware used by APT28, based on Carberp source code, serving as reconnaissance malware.

entities.name: APT28
entities.description: APT28 is a cyber espionage group known for its sophisticated attacks and use of various malware, including JHUHUGIT.

entities.name: QAKBOT
entities.description: QakBot is a modular banking trojan used primarily by financially motivated actors since at least 2007.

entities.name: PROLOCK
entities.description: ProLock is a ransomware variant that has been delivered by QakBot.

entities.name: EGREGOR
entities.description: Egregor is another ransomware variant associated with QakBot's delivery mechanisms.

entities.name: ZEBROC
entities.description: Zebrocy is a Trojan used by APT28 since at least November 2015, available in multiple programming languages.

entities.name: ATTOR
entities.description: Attor is a Windows-based espionage platform with a loadable plugin architecture for specific targets.

entities.name: TINYZBOT
entities.description: TinyZBot is a bot developed by Cleaver, written in C#.

entities.name: GAZER

chunk:
is a trojan written in Visual C++ that has been used by [BITTER](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1002) since at least August 2021, including against Bangladeshi government personnel.(Citation: Cisco Talos Bitter Bangladesh May 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: TinyTurla
Software description: [TinyTurla](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0668) is a backdoor that has been used by [Turla](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0010) against targets in the US, Germany, and Afghanistan since at least 2020.(Citation: Talos TinyTurla September 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: ProLock
Software description: [ProLock](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0654) is a ransomware strain that has been used in Big Game Hunting (BGH) operations since at least 2020, often obtaining initial access with [QakBot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0650). [ProLock](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0654) is the successor to PwndLocker ransomware which was found to contain a bug allowing decryption without ransom payment in 2019.(Citation: Group IB Ransomware September 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Ramsay
Software description: [Ramsay](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0458) is an information stealing malware framework designed to collect and exfiltrate sensitive documents, including from air-gapped systems. Researchers have identified overlaps between [Ramsay](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0458) and the [Darkhotel](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0012)-associated Retro malware.(Citation: Eset Ramsay May 2020)(Citation: Antiy CERT Ramsay April 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RemoteCMD
Software description: [RemoteCMD](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0166) is a custom tool used by [APT3](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0022) to execute commands on a remote system similar to SysInternal's PSEXEC functionality. (Citation: Symantec Buckeye)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Saint Bot
Software description: [Saint Bot](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1018) is a .NET downloader that has been used by [Ember Bear](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G1003) since at least March 2021.(Citation: Malwarebytes Saint Bot April 2021)(Citation: Palo Alto Unit 42 OutSteel SaintBot February 2022 )
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Flame
Software description: [Flame](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0143) is a sophisticated toolkit that has been used to collect information since at least 2010, largely targeting Middle East countries. (Citation: Kaspersky Flame)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Turian
Software description: [Turian](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0647) is a backdoor that has been used by [BackdoorDiplomacy](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0135) to target Ministries of Foreign Affairs, telecommunication companies, and charities in Africa, Europe, the Middle East, and Asia. First reported in 2021, [Turian](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0647) is likely related to Quarian, an older backdoor that was last observed being used in 2013 against diplomatic targets in Syria and the United States.(Citation: ESET BackdoorDiplomacy Jun 2021)
Platforms: Windows, Linux

Software name: CHOPSTICK
Software description: [CHOPSTICK](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0023) is a malware family of modular backdoors used by [APT28](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0007). It has been used since at least 2012 and is usually dropped on victims as second-stage malware, though it has been used as first-stage malware in several cases. It has both Windows and Linux variants. (Citation: FireEye APT28) (Citation: ESET Sednit Part 2) (Citation: FireEye APT28 January 2017) (Citation: DOJ GRU Indictment Jul 2018) It is tracked separately from the [X-Agent for Android](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0314).
Platforms: Windows, Linux

Software name: KeyBoy
Software description: [KeyBoy](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0387) is malware that has been used in targeted campaigns against members of the Tibetan Parliament in 2016.(Citation: CitizenLab KeyBoy Nov 2016)(Citation: PWC KeyBoys Feb 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Brute Ratel C4
Software description: [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) is a commercial red-teaming and adversarial attack simulation tool that first appeared in December 2020. [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was specifically designed to avoid detection by endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus (AV) capabilities, and deploys agents called badgers to enable arbitrary command execution for lateral movement, privilege escalation, and persistence. In September 2022, a cracked version of [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was leaked in the cybercriminal underground, leading to its use by threat actors.(Citation: Dark Vortex Brute Ratel C

entities.name: BITTER
entities.description: Bitter is a cyber threat group that has been active since at least August 2021, targeting various entities including Bangladeshi government personnel.

entities.name: TINY TURLA
entities.description: TinyTurla is a backdoor software used by the Turla group against targets in the US, Germany, and Afghanistan since at least 2020.

entities.name: TURLA
entities.description: Turla is a cyber threat group known for its sophisticated malware and cyber espionage activities.

entities.name: PROLOCK
entities.description: ProLock is a ransomware strain involved in Big Game Hunting operations since at least 2020, often used in conjunction with QakBot.

entities.name: RAMSAY
entities.description: Ramsay is an information stealing malware framework designed to collect sensitive documents, including from air-gapped systems.

entities.name: REMOTECMD
entities.description: RemoteCMD is a custom tool used by APT3 to execute commands on remote systems.

entities.name: SAINT BOT
entities.description: Saint Bot is a .NET downloader used by Ember Bear since at least March 2021.

entities.name: FLAME
entities.description: Flame is a sophisticated toolkit used for information collection, primarily targeting Middle Eastern countries since at least 2010.

entities.name: TURIAN
entities.description: Turian is a backdoor used by BackdoorDiplomacy to target various organizations in Africa, Europe, the Middle East, and Asia.

entities.name: CHOPSTICK
entities.description: CHOPSTICK is a malware family of modular backdoors used by APT28 since at least 2012.

entities.name: KEYBOY
entities.description: KeyBoy is malware used in targeted campaigns against members of the Tibetan Parliament in 2016.

entities.name: BRUTE RATEL C4
entities.description: Brute Ratel C4 is a commercial red-teaming tool designed to avoid detection and facilitate adversarial simulations.

entities.name: QAKBOT
entities.description: QakBot is a malware strain often used to gain initial access in cyber attacks, including those involving ProLock ransomware.

entities.name: DARKHOTEL
entities.description: Darkhotel is a cyber threat group associated with sophisticated malware attacks, including those related to Ramsay.)<|COMPLETE|>

entities.name: EMBER BEAR
entities.description: Ember Bear is a cyber threat group that has been associated with the use of Saint Bot for malicious activities.

entities.name: BACKDOORDIPLOMACY
entities.description: BackdoorDiplomacy is a cyber threat group known for its use of backdoors like Turian to target various organizations.

entities.name: APT28
entities.description: APT28 is a well-known cyber threat group that has utilized CHOPSTICK malware in its operations since at least 2012.

chunk:
was specifically designed to avoid detection by endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus (AV) capabilities, and deploys agents called badgers to enable arbitrary command execution for lateral movement, privilege escalation, and persistence. In September 2022, a cracked version of [Brute Ratel C4](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S1063) was leaked in the cybercriminal underground, leading to its use by threat actors.(Citation: Dark Vortex Brute Ratel C4)(Citation: Palo Alto Brute Ratel July 2022)(Citation: MDSec Brute Ratel August 2022)(Citation: SANS Brute Ratel October 2022)(Citation: Trend Micro Black Basta October 2022)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Revenge RAT
Software description: [Revenge RAT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0379) is a freely available remote access tool written in .NET (C#).(Citation: Cylance Shaheen Nov 2018)(Citation: Cofense RevengeRAT Feb 2019)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Avaddon
Software description: [Avaddon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0640) is ransomware written in C++ that has been offered as Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) since at least June 2020.(Citation: Awake Security Avaddon)(Citation: Arxiv Avaddon Feb 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BackConfig
Software description: [BackConfig](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0475) is a custom Trojan with a flexible plugin architecture that has been used by [Patchwork](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0040).(Citation: Unit 42 BackConfig May 2020)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: JSS Loader
Software description: [JSS Loader](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0648) is Remote Access Trojan (RAT) with .NET and C++ variants that has been used by [FIN7](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0046) since at least 2020.(Citation: eSentire FIN7 July 2021)(Citation: CrowdStrike Carbon Spider August 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: BLUELIGHT
Software description: [BLUELIGHT](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0657) is a remote access Trojan used by [APT37](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0067) that was first observed in early 2021.(Citation: Volexity InkySquid BLUELIGHT August 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: RemoteUtilities
Software description: [RemoteUtilities](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0592) is a legitimate remote administration tool that has been used by [MuddyWater](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0069) since at least 2021 for execution on target machines.(Citation: Trend Micro Muddy Water March 2021)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Pteranodon
Software description: [Pteranodon](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0147) is a custom backdoor used by [Gamaredon Group](https://attack.mitre.org/groups/G0047). (Citation: Palo Alto Gamaredon Feb 2017)
Platforms: Windows

Software name: Remcos
Software description: [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) is a closed-source tool that is marketed as a remote control and surveillance software by a company called Breaking Security. [Remcos](https://attack.mitre.org/software/S0332) has been observed being used in malware campaigns.(Citation: Riskiq Remcos Jan 2018)(Citation: Talos Remcos Aug 2018)
Platforms: Windows

entities.name: BRUTE RATEL C4
entities.description: Brute Ratel C4 is a tool designed to avoid detection by endpoint detection and response (EDR) and antivirus (AV) capabilities, enabling arbitrary command execution for lateral movement, privilege escalation, and persistence.

entities.name: REVENGE RAT
entities.description: Revenge RAT is a freely available remote access tool written in .NET (C#) that allows unauthorized access to a computer.

entities.name: AVADDON
entities.description: Avaddon is ransomware written in C++ that has been offered as Ransomware-as-a-Service (RaaS) since at least June 2020.

entities.name: BACKCONFIG
entities.description: BackConfig is a custom Trojan with a flexible plugin architecture that has been used by Patchwork.

entities.name: JSS LOADER
entities.description: JSS Loader is a Remote Access Trojan (RAT) with .NET and C++ variants that has been used by FIN7 since at least 2020.

entities.name: BLUELIGHT
entities.description: BLUELIGHT is a remote access Trojan used by APT37 that was first observed in early 2021.

entities.name: REMOTEUTILITIES
entities.description: RemoteUtilities is a legitimate remote administration tool that has been used by MuddyWater since at least 2021 for execution on target machines.

entities.name: PTERANODON
entities.description: Pteranodon is a custom backdoor used by Gamaredon Group.

entities.name: REMCO
entities.description: Remcos is a closed-source tool marketed as remote control and surveillance software by a company called Breaking Security, observed in malware campaigns.

entities.name: PATCHWORK
entities.description: Patchwork is a cyber threat group that has utilized BackConfig in their malware campaigns.

entities.name: FIN7
entities.description: FIN7 is a cybercriminal group that has been associated with the use of JSS Loader since at least 2020.

entities.name: APT37
entities.description: APT37 is a cyber threat group known for using the BLUELIGHT remote access Trojan.

entities.name: GAMAREDON GROUP
entities.description: Gamaredon Group is a cyber threat group that has been linked to the use of the Pteranodon backdoor.
